thread.title: British Bankruptcy Day

author: The Editorial Board
title: British Bankruptcy Day
text:
Britain was rocked Wednesday by the bankruptcy filings of the U.K. subsidiary of Toys “R” Us and electronics seller Maplin, putting 5,500 jobs in jeopardy. While every bankrupt company is unhappy in its own way, these are the latest in a string of broadly related corporate crises.
The Toys “R” Us bust follows the Chapter 11 filing of its American parent last year. That bankruptcy was part of the long hangover from pre-2008 monetary-policy-fueled credit excesses that fueled a leveraged buyout in 2005 loading the bricks-and-mortar... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
